700681f-a.title: Bronx: Bryant Avenue - Westchester Avenue
700681f-a.text:
Bryant Ave., West side, from Westchester Ave. to East 167th Street,
showing the Hunt Inn which was erected in 1660. It stood in rear of the
Foxhurst Mansion on the grounds bounded by the triangle of Westchester
Ave., West Farms Hoad and East 167th Street. It was a prominent rendezous
of British officers during the American War for Independence. The inn
was razed between 1900 and 1923 (according to d.W. Bromley maps) and its
site is now (1937) occupied by a 6-story apartment house.
1890.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
